sanskrit_verse:
ऊनद्विवार्षिकं प्रेतं निदध्युर्बान्धवा बहिः ।
अलङ्कृत्य शुचौ भूमावस्थिसञ्चयनादृते ॥ ५.६८॥
transliteration:
ūnadvi-vārṣikaṃ pretaṃ nidadh-yur-bāndhavā bahiḥ |
alankṛtya śucau bhūmāv asthi-sañcayanād ṛte || 5.68||
sph_interpretive_translation: Relatives shall place the body of one who died before the completion of two years outside, adorned and purified, without collecting the bones.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in familial dharma to execute rites for the departed
Causation aligns with cosmic timing; premature death alters ritual obligation
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by relational proximity and spiritual duty
Restoration logic centers on honoring the transition of consciousness, not preserving physical remnants
Consciousness alignment requires adherence to sequential dharmic process, uninterrupted by material attachment
supreme_court_application: In matters concerning infant or early childhood mortality, judicial deference is given to prescribed familial dharmic protocols. The court recognizes that such rites fall under non-negotiable spiritual jurisdiction, requiring no punitive oversight but ensuring compliance with sequential consciousness-based procedures.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa confirms that premature bodily dissolution necessitates a distinct set of dharmic actions. Anupūrvaśaḥ mandates that rites proceed without ossuary collection, reflecting proportional responsibility tied to life duration. This ensures alignment with cosmic order而非 punitive intervention.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Family must perform full external consecration sans bone retrieval
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Designated kin assume charge of sanctified placement
Capacity Restoration: Ritual purity maintained through Vedic injunctions
Integrity Reintegration: Consciousness continuity affirmed via uninterrupted ceremonial flow
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this Dharma stands executed. The act is complete in alignment with Sanatana Vidhi. There is no punishment, only perfected transition. Consciousness remains the Supreme Adjudicator.
